name: Domestic R&D paid for by the company and others and performed by the company, depreciation, capital expenditures, and adjusted domestic R&D, by industry and company size: 2018
description: Domestic R&D paid for by the company and others and performed by the company, depreciation, capital expenditures, and adjusted domestic R&D, by industry and company size: 2018

creator.name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics

variableMeasured.name: field_domestic_r_d_paid_for_by_the_company_and_others
variableMeasured.description: Domestic R D Paid For By The Company And Others

variableMeasured.name: field_depreciation
variableMeasured.unitText: Millions of U.S. dollars and percent change

variableMeasured.name: field_capital_expenditures_related_to_r_d
variableMeasured.description: Capital Expenditures Related To R D
variableMeasured.unitText: Millions of U.S. dollars and percent change

variableMeasured.name: field_adjusted_domestic_r_d_paid_for_by_the_company_and_others
variableMeasured.description: Adjusted Domestic R D Paid For By The Company And Others

variableMeasured.name: field_change_amount
variableMeasured.unitText: Millions of U.S. dollars and percent change

variableMeasured.name: field_change_percent
variableMeasured.unitText: Millions of U.S. dollars and percent change

specialValues.D: suppressed to avoid disclosure of confidential information

notes: Detail may not add to total because of rounding. Industry classification is based on the dominant business code for domestic R&D performance, where available. For companies that did not report business codes, the classification used for sampling was assigned. Statistics are representative of companies located in the United States that performed or funded $50,000 or more of R&D and are not comparable with estimates published for years prior to 2018. An estimate range may be displayed in place of a single estimate to avoid disclosing operations of individual companies. To enable comparisons between U.S. BRDS statistics and those of other nations, in this table an internationally comparable adjusted domestic R&D estimate is calculated by subtracting depreciation relating to R&D operations, which was included in U.S. BRDS domestic R&D, and adding capital expenditures relating to R&D operations, which was excluded from U.S. BRDS domestic R&D.
sources: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics and Census Bureau, Business Research and Development Survey, 2018.
